key_findings.current_bottleneck: File I/O on every authenticated request via findApiKey() in storage.ts
key_findings.file_locking_overhead: up to 500ms potential wait with retry mechanism
key_findings.current_auth_flow: Every request triggers withLock() → readApiKeys() → JSON.parse → array.find()
key_findings.concurrent_issue: File locking creates I/O contention under load

auth_flow: storage.ts - findApiKey() with file I/O bottleneck
middleware/rateLimit.ts - checkRateLimit() using in-memory ApiKey object

performance_issues: Lock acquisition with up to 10 retries × 50ms delays

src/types.ts.key_interface: ApiKey with fields: key, name, model, token_limit_per_5h, expiry_date, created_at, last_used, total_lifetime_tokens, usage_windows

src/middleware/auth.ts.role: Entry point for auth, attaches apiKey to context

existing_caching: NONE - Pure file-based storage with no memoization

implementation_strategy.cache_key: API key string (key field from ApiKey interface)
implementation_strategy.cache_value: ApiKey object or null for not-found keys

risks_and_mitigations.cache_coherency: Risk: Concurrent file updates may stale cache. Mitigation: TTL ensures fresh data, selective invalidation on updates
risks_and_mitigations.memory_bloat: Risk: Many unique API keys. Mitigation: Max size limit with LRU eviction
risks_and_mitigations.ttl_accuracy: Risk: High load may delay expiration checks. Mitigation: Check TTL on every get() call
risks_and_mitigations.auth_breakage: Risk: Cache bugs break authentication. Mitigation: Comprehensive integration tests, feature flag
